intro: Crotalaria depauperata, commonly known as the poor man's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Crotalaria depauperata is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has the ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
